New Records: Shohei Ohtani achieved a career-high 104 runs this season, surpassing his previous mark of 103 set in 2021 with the Los Angeles Angels.
Shohei Ohtani is in pursuit of becoming the first major leaguer in history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a solo home run in the first inning.
Teoscar Hernández hit a go-ahead, three-run homer in the third inning.
Shohei Ohtani stole his 41st and 42nd bases of the season.
Ryan O’Hearn hit an RBI double in the fifth inning.
Anthony Banda pitched 1 1/3 innings of relief to get the victory.
Michael Kopech retired the side in the ninth for his 12th save.
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani and his dog Decoy handled the ceremonial first pitch in front of a sellout crowd of 53,290.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts praised Ohtani, saying, 'Any big moment he seems to rise to the occasion.'
Orioles manager Brandon Hyde commented, 'I thought we had some good ABs early, didn’t do much from the middle of the game on offensively, but yeah, wasn’t our cleanest game.'
Walker Buehler expressed his feelings about his performance, stating, 'I was encouraged as I’ve been since 2021. I felt like I could get guys out. I felt very competitive.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was attended by a sellout crowd of 53,290.
Shohei Ohtani has 14 stolen bases in August, the most by a Dodger in a month since manager Dave Roberts had 15 in March and April in 2004.
Others: Orioles: 2B-SS Jorge Mateo had elbow surgery in Texas and is done for the season.
Dodgers: RHP Jack Flaherty has a sore wrist with minimal swelling after taking a comebacker off it on Tuesday.
Dodgers: RHP Tyler Glasnow (elbow) will travel with the team to Phoenix and resume throwing Friday.
Dodgers: RHP Yoshinobu Yamamoto (tricep) will make a three-inning rehab start next week and could possibly rejoin the team.
Dodgers: RHP Brusdar Graterol (hamstring) threw a 30-pitch bullpen session and will make a rehab start soon.
